alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:58AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Stevens and northern Spokane Counties through 1030 AM PDT... At 957 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles northwest of Suncrest, or 30 miles northwest of Spokane, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springdale, Wellpinit, Ford, Valley, Loon Lake and Clayton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
